The first, 14 May 1537, set up seven ecclesiastical districts or ‘ Classes ’ and ordered periodical ⁴ Colloquies ’ (Ruchat, iv. 413 sqq.). The second, March 1538 (ibid. 451 sqq.) adopted, 4 April, the ceremonies and ‘ the four feasts ', other than Sunday, in use at Bern (Herminjard, iv, No. 698). In Sept. 1539 all priests who still declined 'to conform were deprived and banished (Ruchat, iv. 477).
